content: Many of us veterans and those still fighting are aware of the VA loans to buy their home but, did you know there is a loan that any active duty, reservist, Guard member, vet and their spouses are eligible to apply for to open their own business? It's a program that is still in the trial phase until the end of 2010 and it will go away if not used enough. This is a great benefit to all of us and we need to take advantage of it. Especially those that are close to retirement or are planning a discharge or for their spouse. I would be happy to help anyone out with info about it. Just ask.
reply: Many of us veterans and those still fighting are aware of the VA loans to buy their home but, did you know there is a loan that any active duty, reservist, Guard member, vet and their spouses are eligible to apply for to open their own business? It's a program that is still in the trial phase until the end of 2010 and it will go away if not used enough. This is a great benefit to all of us and we need to take advantage of it. Especially those that are close to retirement or are planning a discharge or for their spouse. I would be happy to help anyone out with info about it. Just ask.
title: USE OR LOSE BENEFIT

title: USE OR LOSE BENEFIT

content: No, I'm not with a government agency and this is not a spam. It is a benefit that I have used and know it could go away. It works the same as the VA home loan all of us know about, and I hear alot of people complaining they can't get a job. Why not use a resource that we earned to provide ourselves with a job. I work for myself and I enjoy helping other vets at no cost. Just trying to help man!

content: On June 14th, 2007, SBA launched a loan program for Veterans called Patriot Express. Patriot Express is part of the SBA 7(a) small business loan program. More information can be found at http://www.sba.gov/patriotexpress / Patriot Express Pilot Loan Initiative
